questions.question: Which coverage protects your future income if an illness prevents you from working long term?
questions.explanation: Long-term disability insurance replaces a portion of income when you cannot work for an extended period due to illness or injury.

questions.question: You have $50,000 in assets. What minimum auto liability limits best align with the lesson guidance?
questions.explanation: Targeting at least 100/300/100 liability coverage better protects assets against lawsuits from serious accidents.

questions.question: Which scenario most strongly signals it is time to add a personal umbrella policy?
options: You moved to a city with higher auto insurance premiums
Your net worth now exceeds your auto liability limits
You bought a new car with higher replacement value
questions.explanation: Umbrella insurance is recommended when your assets or future income exceed underlying liability limits, adding extra protection against lawsuits.

questions.question: Renters insurance covers your belongings even if damage occurs outside your apartment (e.g., theft from a car).
questions.explanation: Personal property coverage typically applies worldwide, though deductibles and limits still apply.

questions.question: Which factor most affects your health insurance out-of-pocket maximum?
options: Plan metal tier and cost-sharing design
questions.explanation: Metal tiers and cost-sharing structures (deductible, coinsurance) determine out-of-pocket maximums in health plans.

questions.question: What is the primary advantage of laddering multiple term life policies?
options: Locking in a lower interest rate
Aligning coverage with changing financial obligations over time
questions.explanation: Laddering lets you match policy duration and amounts to specific goals so coverage declines as obligations disappear.

questions.question: Keeping a high homeowners deductible is risky even when you have a fully funded emergency fund.
questions.explanation: Higher deductibles can be cost-effective when you can self-insure smaller losses with savings.

questions.question: When auditing policies, which document summarizes coverage limits, deductibles, and premiums in one place?
questions.explanation: The declarations page lists key policy details for quick review and comparison during audits.

questions.question: Which step helps ensure beneficiaries receive life insurance proceeds smoothly?
options: Storing the policy in a bank safe deposit box
Placing the policy and instructions in a shared digital vault
questions.explanation: Organizing documents and access instructions in a secure shared location accelerates beneficiary claims.

questions.question: Which coverage must renters most often add separately because landlords rarely provide it?
questions.explanation: Renters must secure personal property coverage themselves; landlord policies only cover the building.
